details.purpose: Register details about ophthalmic studies with regard to the ophthalmic tomography test.
details.use: This archetype can be used for the following: - Register the protocol/strategy used to conduct ophthalmic tomography test. - Review with diagnostic purposes, the studies acquired using ophthalmic tomography, looking for clinically relevant findings on eye fundus.

details.purpose: Registrar los detalles durante los estudios oftálmicos de la prueba de tomografía de coherencia óptica.

items.items: Registra los hallazgos clínicos utilizando la tomografía de coherencia óptica con fines oftálmicos.
Record of clinical findings using optical coherence tomography with ophthalmic purposes.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
Details of the device used to acquire OCT images.
A term, commonly coded, expressing an overall interpretation of the OCT test.
Details of the ophthalmic tomography examination test result for each eye.
Determines the eye on which the test was performed.Matches to DICOM Laterality (0020,0060) attribute.
The anatomic structure analyzed in this study.

Matches to DICOM Anatomic Region Sequence (0008,2218) attribute. Values permitted are defined by DICOM standard (PS 3.16) inside the table with Context ID 4211 (Ophthalmic OCT Anatomic Structure Imaged).
Identifies the fundus imaging modalities obtained from the acquisition of the reference image.
Corresponds to the value 4 of the DICOM image type attribute (0008,0008).
Information about the slices of the retina obtained by OCT the test.
Number of slices in the study (from 1 to n).
Number identifying a frame among the rest in the study, to highlight its relevance on diagnosis.
Current slice of the retina regarding the image of reference.
Information about image reports related to the current OCT study.
Defines the purpose of the report built from data acquired on the OCT device.
Report related to the current OCT study.
Information about the image on which the position of OCT acquisitions/slices will be referenced.
Ophthalmic photography acquisition method chosen to obtain the reference image.

Matches to DICOM Anatomic Region Sequence (0022,0015) attribute. Values permitted are defined by DICOM standard (PS 3.16) inside the table with Context ID 4202 (Ophthalmic Photography Acquisition Device).
Narrative description of clinically relevant information identifiable on the reference image.
Details about a study of thickness of ophthalmic structures.
Patient circumstances which may affect interpretation of the result.
Value of intraocular pressure in mmHg.
Axial length of the eye in mm.
The horizontal field of view in degrees.
Information about the contrast agents administered prior to or during the acquisition.
Matches to DICOM (0018,0012) attribute. Values permitted are defined by DICOM standard (PS 3.16) inside the table with Context ID 4200 (Ophthalmic Imaging Agent).
Volume injected in milliliters of diluted contrast agent.
Milligrams of active ingredient per milliliter of (diluted) agent.
Details of refractive correction applied to each eye.
Information related to retinal thickness measurement.
Image on which the position of OCT acquisitions/slices will be referenced.
Details about slice/s of the retina regarding its/their position in the reference image.
Study of a slice of the retina and measurement of its thickness profile.
Measurement of the thickness profile for each slice of retina in study and comparison of thickness progression in time during a follow-up.
Study of a 3D recontruction of the retina.
Thickness study over the image of reference for multi-frame acquisition.
Thickness progression study between several images of reference using different multi-frame acquisitions taken along time.
Measurement of thickness for retinal nerve fiber layer and comparison regarding the values from an age-adjusted normative database.
Measurement of thickness for retinal nerve fiber layer and comparison regarding other measures obtained during a follow-up process.
Trend study for the evolution of retinal nerve fiber layer thickness.
Study of difference in thickness comparing: values in different eyes (OD-OS), and superior-inferior hemispheres of the same eye.
Study centered in retinal nerve fiber layer thickness and asymmetry of the retina.
Study centered in thickness around the optic nerve and macula.
Corresponds to DICOM Code value C-B02CC.
Corresponds to DICOM Code value C-B0156.
Corresponds to DICOM Code value C-B0295.
Corresponds to DICOM Code value C-22853.
Corresponds to DICOM Code value C-B02C5.
Details of any mydriatic procedure carried out whenever necessary.
Details about the strategy to conduct acquisitions using ophthalmic tomography.
Which kind of graphs are included in the report.
The image of the retina used to indicate the position of OCT slices.
Report including a specific OCT scan.
A 3D reconstruction of eye structure using several OCT frames.
Graph showing the thickness of retina for a specific OCT scan.
Coloured map showing the thickness of retina over the reference image.
Graph representing the thickness of the retinal nerve fiber layer around the optic nerve.
Retinal nerve fiber layer thickness profile measured, compared to normal thickness values for different sections around the optic nerve.
Graph showing the thickness of retina from a specific OCT slice and compares them to values obtained in different acquisitions during a follow-up.
Retinal thickness map obtained from the comparison of thickness values obtained in different acquisitions during a follow-up.
Classification of total thickness measured for different sections around the papilla according to an age-adjusted normative database.
Average thickness values in sections of retina located close to the macula.
Asymmetry map comparing thickness values from different eyes in the same locations.
Asymmetry map comparing thickness at superior and inferior hemispheres in retina.
Graph that represents the evolution along time of the thickness in retinal nerve fiber layer.
Narrative description of clinically relevant information identifiable on the current report.
Narrative description of clinically relevant information identifiable on the specific frames selected from the acquisition.
Every finding considered clinically relevant, found on posterior chamber of the eye.
Narrative description of clinically relevant information identifiable on the analysis of ophthalmic thickness measurements.
Analysis of OCT slices considered relevant in the study.
List of regions of interest in the study of eye.
Findings on the posterior chamber of the eye
List of possible clinical findings on posterior chamber of the eye.
List of ophthalmic photography acquisition devices.
